task1_youtube_transcripts_colombia.title: Colombia's struggle against illegal mining and deforestation

transcript_chunks.speaker: Narrator
transcript_chunks.text: In Colombia, illegal mining continues to devastate indigenous lands, despite ILO 169 protections requiring prior consultation.

transcript_chunks.speaker: Indigenous Representative
transcript_chunks.text: Our communities demand enforcement of consultation laws before any mining concessions are granted.

transcript_chunks.speaker: Expert
transcript_chunks.text: The 2001 Mining Code restricts rights on indigenous territories, but court rulings emphasize consent under ILO 169.

task1_youtube_transcripts_colombia.title: Colombians demand changes to nation's labour laws

transcript_chunks.speaker: Protester
transcript_chunks.text: Reforms must include stronger ILO 169 implementation for mining consultations with indigenous groups.

transcript_chunks.speaker: Analyst
transcript_chunks.text: Congress debates on mining laws highlight the need for prior, free, and informed consent.
